notes: Smallest region by area, highest population density. Mediterranean coast with mild climate, industrial and port activities increase respiratory issues.
Large northeastern region bordering Algeria. Semi-arid climate with moderate temperatures. Good water quality and lower population density help mitigate risks.
Historic cities with high population density. Poor water quality (48), severe air quality issues from urban congestion and industrial activity. High water- and food-borne and respiratory symptoms.
Capital region with second smallest area but highest population. Coastal location with good infrastructure and decent water quality (70) but urban air quality concerns.

Central agricultural region with moderate size. High temperatures (32°C) and poor water quality (52) create significant health risks. Mix of mountains and plains, agricultural activities contribute to vector-borne diseases.

Most populous region, small area = highest density. Major industrial and economic hub. Severe air pollution from traffic and industry (1020 respiratory cases). Poor water quality and very high population stress infrastructure.
Hot interior region with tourist centers. Extreme temperatures (35°C), very poor water quality (42), and high vector-borne diseases (420 cases) due to climate. Highest overall risk score.
Large southeastern desert region with low population. Extreme heat (37°C), low humidity, water scarcity challenges. High vector-borne diseases but lower population density reduces overall impact.
Coastal and interior region with Agadir. Moderate climate, tourism and agriculture. Better water quality (65) and moderate symptoms keep risk at medium level.
Southern region with low population density. Desert climate, sparse population leads to lower absolute case numbers. Moderate water quality and low health incidents.
Second largest region by area, very low population density. Partially in disputed Western Sahara territory. Low health incidents across all categories make this a low-risk region.
Largest region by area, lowest population. Entirely within disputed Western Sahara. Coastal location with moderate climate. Best water quality (66) and lowest health incidents = lowest risk.
